string-array.name: cartoon_name_array
string-array.item: Over the Garden Wall
Adventure Time
Regular Show
Gravity Falls
The Last Airbender
Steven Universe
Rick and Morty
Gumball
BoJack Horseman
Samurai Jack

string-array.name: description_array
string-array.item: Two brothers find themselves lost in a strange forest and must journey through unknown lands to find their way home.
Join Finn the Human and Jake the Dog as they go on surreal and exciting adventures in the magical Land of Ooo.
Mordecai and Rigby, two friends working at a park, deal with everyday problems that often spiral into bizarre situations.
Twins Dipper and Mabel uncover the mysteries of Gravity Falls while spending summer with their Great Uncle Stan.
In a world divided into four nations, young Aang must master the four elements to bring balance and peace.
Follow the journey of Steven, a young boy discovering his powers and heritage with the help of the Crystal Gems.
A scientist and his grandson embark on dangerous, bizarre, and often dimension-hopping adventures together.
Gumball and his adoptive brother Darwin find themselves in humorous, unexpected scenarios in the town of Elmore.
BoJack, a former sitcom star, struggles with addiction and self-worth in a darkly humorous take on fame and life.
A skilled samurai, thrown into a dystopian future, fights to return to his time and defeat the evil demon, Aku.

string-array.name: funfact_array
string-array.item: Over the Garden Wall was the first miniseries made by Cartoon Network and was inspired by early American folk art.
Adventure Time was created by Pendleton Ward, who originally made a short film that went viral online before becoming a full series.
Regular Show was initially pitched as a show for adults but was adapted for a younger audience while keeping quirky humor.
Gravity Falls contains many hidden messages and codes, which have kept fans decoding and discovering secrets for years.
The show\'s creators based Avatar\'s fighting styles on real martial arts, with each element having a unique style.
Steven Universe was the first Cartoon Network show created by a woman, Rebecca Sugar, and has won several awards for inclusivity.
Rick and Mortyâ€™s characters are loosely based on Doc and Marty from Back to the Future, initially as a parody.
The Amazing World of Gumball combines various animation styles, from traditional hand-drawn to 3D CGI, within the same episode.
BoJack Horseman includes detailed background jokes and hidden messages related to Hollywood culture and mental health.
Samurai Jack was created by Genndy Tartakovsky and is praised for its cinematic storytelling and minimal dialogue.
